image.altText: A man in an orange jacket uses binoculars to look at a ship in the distance

props.synopsis: Russia says one of the Venezuela-linked tankers is "our vessel" and demands the quick release of its citizens, as the US pledges to continue seizing ships and keep the pressure on Venezuela's interim leaders.

title.children: US seizes more tankers as it lays out three-phase plan for Venezuela

image.altText: Donald Trump, in a dark blue suit and glossy blue tie, points a finger.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made it clear he's departing from decades of US foreign policy norms, and once-close allies are now questioning what it could mean for them.

title.children: The latest threat to NATO comes from within

image.altText: A maroon car with yellow police tape around it

props.synopsis: The mayor of Minneapolis says the Trump administration's claim the incident was self-defence is not true and told Immigration and Customs Enforcement to get out of the city.

title.children: ICE agent fatally shoots woman amid immigration crackdown

image.altText: Chris Minns New South Wales Premier

props.synopsis: A decade-old Labor fundraiser at the centre of allegations that NSW Premier Chris Minns conspired to evade a state donations law was reported at the time as a much bigger event than official records suggest, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'Bunch of cash': The big little fundraiser causing problems for the NSW premier

image.altText: A photo taken from a paddock of hills in the distance with multiple areas alight with orange fire at dusk.

props.synopsis: Emergency warnings remain in place as out-of-control blazes continue to burn in Victoria ahead of "catastrophic" fire conditions on Friday.

title.children: Reports of property losses as bushfires burn out of control in Victoria

image.altText: teenagers jumping off a bridge into the water

props.synopsis: A breeze will bring a brief reprieve for coastal areas of Victoria and South Australia today before the heat and fire danger ramps up again tomorrow.

title.children: State-by-state breakdown of the heatwave as a 47C day looms for some

image.altText: An image of an Indigenous man in a grey shirt standing in a park.

props.synopsis: Paul Silva says he plans to defy NSW's new protest restrictions to rally against Indigenous deaths in custody.

title.children: First Nations rally organiser vows to defy 'inhumane' NSW protest laws

image.altText: A supplied image of Kenneth John GILES, a caucasian man with wire frame glasses and a long goatee.

props.synopsis: Police are urging anyone who sees Kenneth John Giles or a white ute to call Triple Zero, as significant resources are deployed.

title.children: Gunshot in rural WA prompts police search for 58yo man, woman injured

image.altText: Jacob Bethell completes a shot through the off side

props.synopsis: Jacob Bethell's brilliant maiden Test century sets up an intriguing finish in Sydney, but leaves everyone bemused as to where this precocious young player has been all summer.

title.children: England's brightest hope and biggest blunder sets up Sydney finale

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: The Aussie market is set to open lower as the price of gold and oil drop. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to slip, as gold and oil prices trade lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wall St closes - summary of the day
Interview with RBA deputy governor coming up

image.altText: Carriages from a derailed freight train.

props.synopsis: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

title.children: A derailed freight train has shut a key railway line. Here's what we know

image.altText: Yongah Hill Sign

props.synopsis: A foreign national has his visa cancelled and is facing deportation from Australia, amid claims of links to the "White Australia" movement.

title.children: UK citizen described as 'good friend' by White Australia movement to be deported

image.altText: Police officers with backs to camera beside police van.

props.synopsis: Tactical Operations police burst into the Central Coast house and opened fire on a 49-year-old armed with a sharp object who tried to set fire to an officer using an aerosol can, police say.

title.children: NSW police storm house, fatally shoot man after six-hour seige

image.altText: A triptych of three images from female social media influencers with text graphics overlaid

props.synopsis: Americans are posting sunny social media dispatches about their new lives in Australia, but there is something more revealing underneath.

title.children: 'I'm an American living in Australia': Inside a revealing trend

image.altText: An older woman in a green jumper sitting in a park.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian woman who was forced to give up her newborn daughter in 1969 says decisions about a planned redress scheme, which appear to have been made ahead of consultation, have made her feel worthless.

title.children: Forced adoption survivor says Tas compensation figure 'totally inadequate'

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and earrings looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

title.children: A vast expanse, a missing woman, and doubt she's even out there at all

image.altText: Bobbi Lockyer wears a pink shirt and works on an Aboriginal art piece featuring turquoise blue water

props.synopsis: Indigenous artist Bobbi Lockyer has been left frustrated after she sent a $4,000 custom artwork of the Pilbara to a buyer in Queensland, only for an empty cardboard sleeve to be delivered.

title.children: Aboriginal artist Bobbi Lockyer in tears as Australia Post loses $4k painting

image.altText: A crocodile swims at Crocodylus Park with trees reflected in the water.

props.synopsis: Rangers in the Northern Territory have caught an average of a crocodile per day in the first week of 2026, including one measuring 4.9 metres pulled from waters near a popular swimming spot.

title.children: NT rings in new year with a crocodile captured each day so far

image.altText: Harry Potter (AAP)

props.synopsis: In today's timelines quiz, your challenge is to guess which historic event of the 20th century came first.

title.children: ABC timelines quiz: From Einstein to the Hindenburg, Sputnik to Harry Potter, pick which came first

image.altText: Two male tennis players wearing black shirts whisper to each other on the court.

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis's doubles campaign at the Brisbane International has come to an end after an entertaining tiebreak decider against France.

title.children: Tiebreak defeat spells end for Special Ks at Brisbane International

image.altText: Maya Joint pumps her fist at the United Cup.

props.synopsis: World number four Coco Gauff describes Maya Joint as a "great talent" ahead of a potential match-up against the 19-year-old Australian at the United Cup.

title.children: Two-time major winner Gauff heaps praise on rising Aussie star Joint

image.altText: Emerson Jones serves at Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: Emerson Jones gave a glimpse of her potential at the Brisbane International, with her 2026 season getting underway in promising fashion.

title.children: Australian teenager Jones targeting massive rankings jump in 2026

image.altText: A female tennis player in a purple dress and cap hits a backhand.

props.synopsis: Australian players Kimberly Birrell and Olivia Gadecki have fallen in the second round of the Brisbane International, along with rising star Emerson Jones, who went out after a high-quality encounter with the world number 17.

title.children: Australians record second-round losses at Brisbane International

image.altText: A group of men in maroon shirts playing tug of war.

props.synopsis: The ancient sport of tug of war is being kept alive in Brisbane by an enthusiastic team, and some are calling for it to return to the Olympics.

title.children: The Brisbane team pulling together to keep an ancient sport alive

image.altText: A man stands on a hillside with trees, holding a large map of the E1 project.

props.synopsis: Critics say the E1 project would prevent the establishment of a contiguous Palestinian state.

title.children: Israel cleared to start West Bank settlement construction

image.altText: A man with glasses and moustache leaves court with files under his left arm.

props.synopsis: Aldrich Ames, who was 84, betrayed Western intelligence assets to the Soviet Union and Russia in one of the most damaging intelligence breaches in US history.

title.children: Ex-CIA agent convicted of spying for Soviets dies in prison

image.altText: a large pile of sandy seaweed on a beach next to a digger and a truck

props.synopsis: Piles of kelp were removed from a popular Sydney beach, although some councils prefer to leave the seaweed for its environmental benefit.

title.children: Diggers remove 50 tonnes of seaweed from Sydney beach as masses wash up

image.altText: A colourful illustrations shows the neon paths of computer circuits arranged to resemble an illuminated human brain.

props.synopsis: When a journalist emails a company with questions looking for answers, the least they expect is a real person to feed them the spin, half-truths or outright lies. Not a machine.

title.children: How an encounter with an AI hallucination raised an ethical dilemma

image.altText: cattle standing in floodwater looking up at the camera in a helicopter

props.synopsis: The number of livestock found dead across north-west Queensland is expected to rise, but for already devastated producers, a potential cyclone brings the threat of more rain.

title.children: Cattle producers reeling with 29,000 stock loss, and more rain coming

image.altText: Vehicle in shipping container

props.synopsis: Queensland Police say 60 Toyota LandCruisers and Prados were stolen across Brisbane between October 20 and December 1.

title.children: Men charged over alleged international theft syndicate targeting Toyota 4WDs

image.altText: A young, bearded man with spiky hair, apparently in a bathroom.

props.synopsis: Two men are set to face court over the alleged murder of another prisoner in a Queensland jail.

title.children: Two men charged over alleged prison murder

image.altText: A person inserts a needle into a dose of Pfizer vaccine.

props.synopsis: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

title.children: Bayer's Monsanto sues COVID vaccine makers for alleged mRNA infringement

image.altText: A man wearing a green and grey spray jacket and white cap smiling with his hands resting on a white paling fence

props.synopsis: A retired detective has been remembered as an "incredibly moral and honest man" at a funeral service three weeks after he was killed in the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: 'It feels wrong': Final Bondi terror attack funeral held in Sydney

image.altText: blowfly

props.synopsis: Forecast heatwave conditions across large parts of the country could mean flies and maggots are more prevalent. Here's how to deal with them.

title.children: How to avoid fly and maggot infestations in your home
